place.name: CAMERTON
place.gazetteerText: CAMERTON, a parish in Clutton district, Somerset: on the Fosse way and the Radford canal, 5½ miles SSW of Twerton r. station and 6½ SW of Bath. An act was passed in 1863 to construct a railway from the Great Western at Bristol to Radstock, with a branch to Camerton. The parish includes part of Carlingcott hamlet; and its Post Town is Timsbury, under Bath. Acres, 1,748. Real property, £6,532. Pop., 1,368. Houses, 279. The property is divided among a few. Camerton Park is the seat of John Jarrett, Esq. Coal is worked. Roman pottery, glass, and other relics, and remains of Roman villas, have been found. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £481.* Patron, John Jarrett, Esq. The church is good; and contains several very fine tombs of the Carews. There are chapels for Baptists and Wesleyans. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
